# Copilot Instructions for JacobDarling-marketing-portfolio

## Project Overview

This is Jacob Darling's marketing portfolio website repository. The purpose is to showcase marketing projects, campaigns, and professional experience.

## Code Standards and Conventions

### General Guidelines
- Keep code clean, readable, and well-documented
- Follow industry best practices for web development
- Ensure all changes are responsive and mobile-friendly
- Maintain accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 Level AA)

### File Organization
- Keep assets organized in appropriate directories
- Use clear, descriptive file names
- Maintain consistent naming conventions (kebab-case for files and directories)

### HTML/CSS Standards
- Use semantic HTML5 elements
- Write clean, maintainable CSS
- Ensure cross-browser compatibility
- Optimize images and assets for web performance

### Content Guidelines
- Maintain professional tone and language
- Ensure all marketing content is accurate and up-to-date
- Include proper attribution for external resources
- Keep portfolio items organized and easy to navigate

## Development Workflow

### Before Making Changes
1. Review existing code structure and conventions
2. Understand the scope of the requested changes
3. Ensure changes align with the portfolio's professional purpose

### Testing
- Test in multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- Verify responsive design on various screen sizes
- Check accessibility using browser tools
- Validate HTML and CSS

### Documentation
- Update README.md if adding new features or significant changes
- Document any new dependencies or requirements
- Include comments for complex logic or non-obvious code

## Specific Requirements

### Portfolio Content
- Maintain a professional presentation
- Ensure all links work correctly
- Keep contact information current
- Showcase projects with clear descriptions and visuals

### Performance
- Optimize images before committing
- Minimize CSS and JavaScript files when appropriate
- Ensure fast page load times

### SEO and Metadata
- Include proper meta tags
- Use descriptive titles and headings
- Implement proper schema markup for portfolio items

## Security
- Never commit sensitive information (API keys, passwords, etc.)
- Sanitize any user inputs
- Keep dependencies up to date

## Issue Guidelines

When working on issues:
- Small, focused changes are preferred
- Test thoroughly before submitting
- Update documentation as needed
- Follow the existing code style
